cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi NNW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across western Cuba into the central Gulf of Mexico and toward the northern Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coast) late Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (near the Morgan City–New Orleans area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border to the Alabama/Florida border (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cameron LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border including Lake Pontchartrain/New Orleans (hurricane watch) and Sabine Pass TX to AL/FL border (storm-surge watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: western Cuba today, then northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas to Alabama Sunday–Monday
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands may bring occasional gusts approaching tropical-storm force; sustained gale-force winds are unlikely (6 % chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the immediate coast and in Tampa Bay at times of high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands could drop 1–3 in of rain Saturday into Sunday, producing brief localized ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along Gulf beaches beginning this weekend
